description: Basement excavation with two skylights with lightwell and alteration to fenestration to rear (No. 49); ground floor rear extensions, full-width dormers; and rooflights to the front roof slope (No.49-51)
decision_conditions: <p>The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this permission.</p><p><br></p><p></p><p>REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).</p>

<p>The Development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.</p>

<p>Unless otherwise specified on the drawings hereby approved, all new materials in respect of all the works hereby approved (and any other incidental works to be carried out in this connection) shall match the existing building in respect of materials used, detailed execution, and finished appearance.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: In the interests of visual amenities of the surrounding area</p>

<p><span id="docs-internal-guid-0e19c863-7fff-f6a7-329d-4a4f9f0adc29"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; font-variant-emoji: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space-collapse: preserve;">Prior to superstructure works, detailed specification, a drainage layout and a management &amp; maintenance plan (where applicable) of at least one suitable sustainable drainage system (i.e. water butt with overflow, raingarden, bioretention planter box, living roof (substrate depth of 80-150mm excluding the vegetative mat), permeable paving etc.) shall be submitted to, and approved by the LPA, in consultation with the LLFA. If soakaways i.e. plastic modules and soakaway rings are used, an infiltration test must be carried out to ensure that the capacity of the soil is suitable for infiltration. It must be demonstrated that there will be no increase in surface water flow being discharged offsite and an overall reduction in peak flow rate and volume.</span></span></p><p><span id="docs-internal-guid-0e19c863-7fff-f6a7-329d-4a4f9f0adc29"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; font-variant-emoji: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space-collapse: preserve;">Reason:</span></span></p><p><font face="Arial, sans-serif"><span style="font-size: 13.3333px; white-space-collapse: preserve;">In order to be in accordance with </span></font><span style="background-color: transparent; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt; white-space-collapse: preserve;">London Plan Policy SI 12 and Policy </span><span style="background-color: transparent; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt; white-space-collapse: preserve;">LP53 of Hackney Local Plan LP33 (2020) </span></p>

<p><span id="docs-internal-guid-dc3a2e00-7fff-0e9b-bd75-7b786203c69c"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; font-variant-emoji: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space-collapse: preserve;">A scheme for the provision and implementation of flood resilient and resistant construction details and measures for the basement extension and lightwell against groundwater flood risk shall be submitted to and agreed, in writing with the LPA in consultation with the LLFA prior to the construction of the measures. The scheme shall be carried out in its entirety before the basement extension is occupied and; constructed and completed in accordance with the approved plans in line with BS 8102:2022 Protection of below ground structures against water ingress - code of practice.</span></span></p><p><span id="docs-internal-guid-dc3a2e00-7fff-0e9b-bd75-7b786203c69c"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; font-variant-emoji: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space-collapse: preserve;">Reason:</span></span></p><p><span id="docs-internal-guid-dc3a2e00-7fff-0e9b-bd75-7b786203c69c"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; font-variant-emoji: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space-collapse: preserve;"><font face="Arial, sans-serif" style="font-size: 14px; white-space-collapse: collapse;"><span style="font-size: 13.3333px; white-space-collapse: preserve;">In order to be in accordance with </span></font><span style="background-color: transparent; font-size: 10pt;">London Plan Policy SI 12 and Policy </span><span style="background-color: transparent; font-size: 10pt;">LP53 of Hackney Local Plan LP33 (2020) </span></span></span></p>

<p>The roof of the single storey extensions at No.49 and 51 Linthorpe Road hereby approved shall not be used as a terrace, balcony or similar amenity area.</p><p>REASON: In the interests of neighbours amenities.</p>

<p>The extensions hereby approved at the two properties are to be undertaken as one development and works are not to be substantially completed at either property until such a time as works are commenced at the other property.</p><p>REASON:&nbsp;To ensure that a partially completed development does not result in an obtrusive and incompatible form of development detrimentally impacting on the character and appearance of the properties.</p>
